answers.answer: Hi,I am afraid I do not have a definite idea what this could be. In relation to his diabetes, he should contact his doctor to be sure this is not a pre-emptive warning regarding heart disease(which may not show up as chest pain in a diabetic). It is unlikely to be neuropathy given his diabetes being mild as you say. If his BP is not well controlled it may contribute. It sounds more likely  to be a nerve problem, but he will need to be examined and have radiology studies for this to be determiend. Contact his doctor soon to have this arranged.take care.

I know exactly what you are describing. I'm 53 and was diagnosed about a year and a half ago with type 2 pre-diabetes,  I tried to explain those same exact symptoms to my doctor and he looked at me like I was nuts.  Mine are very short, less than 30 seconds at a time, sometimes several times a day, and remind me of grabbing onto an electric fence. Mostly upper body.  Not painful, just not "normal".  I have been taking Glucophage once a day for my diabetes ever since I was diagnosed but those symptoms had started before I started taking any medication for my diabetes.In March of 2006 Drs. found heart blockage and I had to have a stent put in.  I was put on 11 different medications, 2 of which were Plavix and Vytorin.  It wasn't until about 2 months ago that I was given blood pressure medication. So if it has anything to do with medication, I would have to think that it must be the cholesterol medicine.  I'm going to be going back to the doctor (a different one) in the next two weeks and I planned on discussing this with him.  I will post what he tells me.

question: My husband has had for the past 2 weeks sporatic feelings of "electrical currents" thru his neck, head, shoulders, back and chest. It lasts for about a minute and is not painful. He is borderling diabetic and is on no medicine for it, just diet. He takes medicine for cholestrol and blook pressure which are under control. Does any one have any idea what this is?
title: vibrational feelings in my body
